attributes.action: Make compassionate leave a Statutory Right With Reasonable Period off & full pay
attributes.background: compassionate leave is not offered in my contract, I researched this online and found that this is not a statutory right. If like me you work on commission and earn a low salary you will struggle financially in an emergency, I think this needs to change and people should have the right to grieve.
attributes.additional_details:
My wife's grandmother died and we had to fly to get to the funeral, upon my return I was told that I would need to use my 5 of my holiday days (I only get 20) as they didn't offer compassionate leave. I thought this was unfair and I feel that this needs to change and should be a basic right. 

gov.uk website 
"pay, your employer may pay you for time off to look after dependents but they don't have to. check your contact, company handbook or internet site to see if there are rules about this. "

attributes.action: UK Government to create a scheme to help people to manage their gambling.
attributes.background: Gambling was legalised in 1961 for better government control and to allow SMALL bets to be placed. There are 450k-2million problem gamblers that effect 2-10million people in the UK. Can i suggest that the UK government considers the introduction of a 'gambling card' that will control gambling.
attributes.additional_details: I believe there is a 'conflict of interest' letting betting companies deal with 'Self exclusion' and 'Affordability checks'. Betting companies do not identify problem gamblers and there is no instructions how they could identify problem gamblers. Amounts placed and frequency is not monitored. Could the government, working with betting firms, consider a 'gambling card' be introduced based on someone's income. Gambling is not FUN if someone can lose more than they can afford to.

attributes.action: Increase funding for research into pancreatic cancer
attributes.background: Pancreatic cancer is one of the hardest to catch, even if caught eairly enough still over 90% of patients die within a year. I want to ensure that more research money is allocated to help find better treatment as well as diognoses to ensure more people have a better chance of survival -1% at the min
attributes.additional_details: See pancreatic cancer charity for more information

attributes.action: Offer all GCSE, A level and University students a mental health check
attributes.background: Lots of young adults have mental health issues and don't speak out about it and are scared to. To stop this from developing all students should have a mental health check yearly between years 10 to finishing university. This can then get all students the help that they deserve and should have.
attributes.additional_details: School is hard enough to get through and deal with during these stressful times without having disorders and everything holding you down. This can become easier through knowing who has these issues and helping them through the process.

attributes.action: Improve school lunch standards to ensure all children eat lunch
attributes.background: I have raised concern over many school children not eating lunch during school. This is due to unappetizing and unhygienic meals which put's the school children off of their food. This is a major concern because the school children are missing out on vital nutrients required to grow.
attributes.additional_details: Not only do the children find the food disgusting and extremely unappetizing, both teachers and parents have also commented on the situation and are worried about the health of students from leaving out such vital nutrients. Without a sustainable amount of energy, school children will be unable to concentrate during lessons which may affect their education.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for prisoners to share a cell.
attributes.background:
Prison is a very stressful and violent environment. People are placed there to be so called "reabilitated'.
In order for a prisoner to progress, inmates should not have to endure the added suffering that is to share a cell.
How would you feel if you had to go to the toilet in front of a stranger.
attributes.additional_details:
I understand prison is place for people who broke the law but prison nowadays are full of people suffering from mental health issues who should not be there in the first place.
Prisons are the new "Asylums" and inmates suffering from mental health issues are particularly vulnerable in a cell sharing scenario.
Prison is about the loss of freedom, not suffering further torture while inside one.

attributes.action: A fresh look at Hi-tech solutions to reduce traffic congestion nationwide.
attributes.background:
Using roads sensibly will save most people money and will help save lives; according to the BBC article 1 in 6 deaths worldwide are due to pollution. 
We want the government to look at solutions available today that can dramatically reduce congestion, such as a smart phone app for car sharing.
attributes.additional_details:
Using a Car share app on a phone provides high levels of safety and an alternate lift home if necessary. 

The government is obliged to improve air quality.  http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-38990192
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-41678533

Using DfT report from 2005, an example an average car travelling 20 miles each day with 3 occupants, will save Â£1,000 per occupant per year.  
http://webarchive.nationalarchives.gov.uk/+/http:/www.dft.gov.uk/pgr/sustainable/cars/makingcarsharingmarch2005.pdf

attributes.action: Provide mental health training to all teachers
attributes.background: Specialised mental health training for teachers will help them to identify children with mental health issues and get them the help they need. I want an end to the stigma.

attributes.action: Debt agencies should only charge a small percentage fee for recovery of any debt
attributes.background: Companies and debt agencies should only be allowed to charge a very small percentage fee for any recovery of debts.
attributes.additional_details: Debt is a nationwide epidemic, companies and debt agencies have been exploiting peopleâs financial difficulties, and charging excessive amounts of money to recover any debt, often pushing people into further debt, and even bankruptcies and/or debt relief orders. Writing people off financially for years and sometimes preventing them from ever getting back on there financial feet again. Debt is a very stressful, experience causing anxiety, depression and even suicides. Itâs time to change the la !

attributes.action: Stop stretched NHS staff being criminalised and struck off for honest mistakes.
attributes.background: We ask government to adopt a âjustâ approach in healthcare investigation to ensure staff arenât scapegoated for systemic errors. 1) Change the Law so staff errors are only prosecuted if intentional or grossly careless 2) Change the Medical Act so regulators are limited to retraining, not punishment.
attributes.additional_details:
NHS working conditions are incredibly stretched. Despite understaffing and underfunding, staff face criminal charges and losing their licence to work forever if they make an honest mistake. This is unfair, unconstructive and worsens patient safety. 

We ask government to adopt a âjustâ/âno blameâ approach to healthcare investigation (like the aviation industry) to save taxpayers money, improve NHS working conditions and staff retainment, and streamline error investigation to make patients safer.

This petition has been co-authored by Dr Hugo Farne and Dr Jenny Vaughan

attributes.action: Prohibit operating tractors & other agricultural vehicles between 07:30 - 09:00
attributes.background: A tailback of cars stretching miles behind a tractor during rush hour in the morning is a sight many of the British public are accustomed to. Their use not only causes huge delays to travel times but puts other drivers at risk of incident as a result of forced manoeuvre.
attributes.additional_details: Many of us have experienced considerable delays due to these vehicles, whose operation at peak rush hour is generally dispensible and subservient at these hours. Tractors also breed anger into the drivers who are stuck behind them, with no hope of manoeuvring unless subjecting themselves to an incident. The difference in time between agricultural vehicles travelling at 8am rather than 9am is negligible and should be considered when contemplating this petition.

attributes.action: Protect house purchasers/vendors with a defined process/law & financial penalty
attributes.background:
A few years ago I âsoldâ my property 4 times but only the 5th sale completed.

A property purchase/sale is the single biggest transaction but  there is no law to protect buyer or seller, the industry relies on morales.
attributes.additional_details:
Purchasers need to be given a cooling off period and then after this there should be defined criteria or extenuating circumstances for pulling out. 

Vendors should not be allowed to pull out of a sale except for extenuating circumstances. 

There should be a financial commitment prior to exchange which reimburses loses.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for horse owners to pick up their horse droppings
attributes.background: Living in a rural village in Berkshire I often see a lot of horse pooh in the road and never once a person cleaning it up, after my 6 and 8 year old sons pointing this out, why dog owners do why donât horse owners it is unsanitary to surely in this day and age?

attributes.action: Free NHS prescriptions to families of Veterans who receive War Pensions AFCS
attributes.background: Veterans who have been awarded compensation for injuries sustained whilst serving this country are having to pay for NHS prescriptions due to their income being over the benefit rate.There is an employability supplement that equates to the ESA payment yet without the benefits of free healthcare.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to use lies as part of a campaign for a public vote
attributes.background: The use of lies in public campaigns is  growing

attributes.action: Give disabled victims of crime funding for support & services to obtain justice!
attributes.background: Disabled people such as those suffering with Autism find dealing with stress and anxiety very difficult, especially when they are victims of crime, it has a huge negative impact on their health, their life both at work and at home as well as their mental well being.
attributes.additional_details: Adequate funding and support should always be available via a bespoke fund for those disabled victims such as autistics or those with mental disabilities ensuring their needs are met to provide the services and support required so the most vulnerable in our society, who struggle to cope with life in general, let alone when they are the victims of crime are not left alone to deal with courts, ombudsman, regulators, MP's, media and police plus all the paperwork and documentation it entails.

attributes.action: Stop giving taxpayers' money to the National Union of Students (NUS).
attributes.background:
NUS is a political organisation not a union and thus must not be given taxpayers money. 
 
http://mallarduk.com/as-a-student-the-nus-continues-to-embarrass-me%E2%94%82-matt-gillow

attributes.action: Force all local councils to offer a dedicated plastic waste bin
attributes.background: In the wake of the current plastic crisis I find it staggering that there are still councils like mine in Swindon that do not provide people with a dedicated plastic waste bin.
attributes.additional_details: For example in Swindon if we wish to recycle plastic we have to buy white bin bags and then the waste will be collected. No it doesn't cost much but it is obviously enough to put people off and that is evident every bin collection day. So while the government think about what the consumer can do to help the issue with plastic bottle return points, I think they need to also look at what they should be doing and this is a simple step already offered by other councils.

attributes.action: Automatic British Citizenship for Indefinite Leave to Remainers settled 15 years
attributes.background: My parents immigrated to the UK with my sister and I in 1988. I obtained ILR status in 2001 having lived in the U.K. since aged 2, gone to university and worked here all my life. Itâs not fair to have to sit a test and pay Â£1330 to become Naturalised. Britain has been my home all my life.
attributes.additional_details: I am 31 years old. I have lived in the U.K. for 29 years.  I have had ILR status since 2001 (for 17 years). It is not fair to have to sit a life in the UK test and pay Â£1330 to become naturalised. Iâve gone to nursery, primary school, secondary school and  University and spent my whole working life in the U.K. The Government even recognise my 9 month old daughter as British so why do I have to pay over the odds when I pay tax and national insurance and have done my whole working life!

attributes.action: Provide free legal aid for those on low incomes and benefits
attributes.background: Some of the poorest families in England and Wales are being denied legal aid because they cannot afford the financial contributions they are required to make, This is a travesty and totally unfair sign this petition to give justice to the poorest in our society. Give them free access to lawyers.
attributes.additional_details:
A study commissioned by the body that represents solicitors criticised the fact that many on low incomes are being deprived of access to justice by the very system that is supposed to support them.

The report, titled Priced out of Justice?, looked at means testing regulations which control  and how applicants resisting eviction from their homes, for example, are unable to obtain legal representation.

How can this be happening in a modern day democracy. Its reminiscent of the 18th and 19th C

attributes.action: Require all toll bridges to treat disabled people equally
attributes.background: The Government must require parity for all disabled people to use toll bridges and roads for free, not just those on Disability Living Allowance. For example, Iâm disabled but too old to qualify for disability living allowance which means I canât use the Dartford river crossing for free.
attributes.additional_details: As a blue badge holder I can go through London without paying the congestion charge surely it should be the same using the Dartford river crossing. This is free for people who receive Disability Living Allowance and has an exemption from paying vehicle tax as a result. However anyone in my position is still required to pay due to being too old to apply for Disability Living Allowance.

attributes.action: No military action in Syria until perpetrators of chemical attacks are verified.
attributes.background: Involvement in missile strikes or other military action against the Syrian government will escalate the conflict, resulting in yet greater loss of life. Please hold back until we know more.

attributes.action: Write all laws in Plain English
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, believe that in order for the majority of the people to fully participate in the governance of the country, our laws should be written in a language that the people can readily understand.
attributes.additional_details:
We further believe that the current practice of drafting and presenting laws in Legal English and âLegaleseâ is detrimental to a truly representative Parliament and the involvement of the people in the government of the country.

We therefore demand that all future laws made in the UK Parliament should be written in Plain English.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of peanut products in cinemas
attributes.background: Going to the cinema can be a traumatic time for many people with a peanut/nut allergy. Spending most of the time looking around to make sure that someone next to you is not about to open a packet of Peanut M&Mâs or another product containing peanuts. Families should feel safe in a place of enjoyment
attributes.additional_details:
Peanut allergies affect 1 in 55 children in the UK, why put our children at risk in a place that is suppose to be enjoyable? 
 Every cinema I have visited in the UK so far sells Peanut M&Mâs as a film-time snack. Are there not enough other snacks available without the need to sell peanut based products?? 
 Nuts are in the top 3 most common food allergies in the UK to date, and with this allergy being also airborne this causes more of a danger in close public spaces such as cinemas.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for motorbikes to have different coloured headlamps to cars
attributes.background: Driving at night, in heavy traffic or in wet weather it is often difficult to differentiate a motorbike weaving down between lanes from other cars.  If motorbikes had a different coloured headlamp (yellow maybe), drivers, incl. other riders, looking in rear/side view mirrors would better spot them.
attributes.additional_details: I think this would significantly improve road safety by reducing the number of car accidents with motorbikes when they are not seen by drivers joining / changing lanes in heavy traffic.  The headlight colour would obviously need to be one that would afford the bike rider equal visibility.

attributes.action: Impose a safety check on all animal toys
attributes.background: Animals are just seen as pets to most but to many they are like a family member. Children's toys have to pass a safety check so animal toys should have to too. This issue needs addressing urgently.
attributes.additional_details: There's been many pet deaths caused by pet toys. My friends dog nearly died through playing with a dog toy and my dog was playing tug with one of her toys which the inside was sticking out. A very sharp plastic tube is the only way I can describe it held together with a small piece of sellotape hidden under woven rope. This could have caused my dog serious harm.

attributes.action: Start development of a satellite carrier rocket.
attributes.background: During the 1960s a British rocket named Black Arrow was created that was capable of launching payloads into orbit. However, the program was cancelled in order to save money which left the UK the only country to successfully develop and then cancel an indigenous space rocket.
attributes.additional_details:
-Black Arrow was cancelled in order to save cost, however it was a comparatively cheap rocket design.
-All other countries that have successfully developed rocket technologies have continued to develop them further.
-The lack of our own launch system has led us to rely on foreign countries, such as the Russian Soyuz rocket, which we could be prevented from using their equipment if we fall out of favour with their governments.

attributes.action: Remove defensive architecture to help homeless people sleep safely
attributes.background: We undersign our HM Government to make it illegal for businesses and local communities to have defensive architecture on their buildings and benches. This is so that homeless people can have somewhere to sleep safely at night, without being harmed

attributes.action: Let contraceptives be sold over-the-counter
attributes.background: Contraceptives are currently not sold over-the-counter, you have to get a prescription for one. I believe that this should change. Many people require contraceptive pills and other forms of contraception for different reasons, and they have to go through too much hassle. Make pills over the counter!
attributes.additional_details: People need contraceptives. Women and men - regardless of sexuality - need them to stop STIs and unplanned pregnancies. Transgender men who aren't on HRT can use them to stop their periods, and they may have a judgmental family who would treat them harshly if they found out this was why they were getting contraception - especially 13-to-16-year-olds. Making contraceptives over-the-counter will benefit so many people in terms of health and confidentiality, so what are we waiting for?

attributes.action: Restrict social media use by children to help prevent cyberbullying
attributes.background:
We urge Parliament to consider new laws, banning the posting of content to social media / video-sharing sites by under-18s. 

Children should be focussed on developing real life social skills, and deserve a childhood free from the pressures and bullying which go hand in hand with social media use.
attributes.additional_details:
Social media / video-sharing websites are often used as a way to bully other children, and in some cases teachers too, something from which the victim has no opportunity to escape, even at home.

Children should not be posting content online, until they have reached an age at which they have been fully educated about its use/misuse, can understand the emotional damage bullying online may cause, and the legal ramifications of broadcasting inappropriate content or making libelous remarks online.

attributes.action: Raise awareness of Mental illness in the South Asian and Islamic communities
attributes.background: We would like the government to intervene and educate community leaders, to prevent further stigma and abuse received by South Asians and particularly muslims who suffer from mental health issues, which results in mental health abuse, due to lack of intelligence in the subject by those in authority.

attributes.action: Introduce new regulations for the development of Artificial Intelligence.
attributes.background: Artificial Intelligence is intelligent behaviour, exhibited by computers. Currently AI is at a primitive stage, home assistants are starting to play a role in our lives, but what they can do for us is limited. I want to see new regulations, for further development of AI and Machine Learning.
attributes.additional_details:
Many experts, including founder of Microsoft, Bill Gates, and Professor Stephen Hawking, have raised concerns over the development of AI. Many in particular believe that, by 2045, the point of Technological Singularity will occur. This means that, if AI is developed, without regulation, it could surpass human intelligence.

AI is useful at the present time, however, continuing to develop this, without limits, is dangerous. Machines will always make mistakes, let's not become inferior to them.

attributes.action: Set a minimum price per calorie for unhealthy foods
attributes.background: People have become accustomed to eating foods such as fast food, chocolate, sweets etc. These are unnecessarily high in calories and, as a result, directly fuel the obesity crisis. A minimum price per calorie would force these foods to be made with the same taste and far fewer calories.
attributes.additional_details:
Suggestion: 1p per calorie.  

E.g. In order to sell a typical fast food lunch of currently 1000 calories would cost a prohibitive Â£10.  In order to sell the same meal for Â£5, fast food chains would be forced to create the same, good tasting meal for only 500 calories.

attributes.action: Ban positive action in organisations and have all candidates treated equally.
attributes.background: Positive action is unfair. For example, a wealthy female will have an advantage over a less affluent male when it comes to recruitment. No organisation should ask for race, religion, gender or sexuality. This is not relevant to the job and results in less effective recruitment UK wide.
attributes.additional_details: Companies and government organisations should be concerned with finding the best, regardless of non-relevant issues such as a persons sexuality. Employers should be blind when it comes to who gets through to assessment centres and interviews. Itâs not fair that suddenly every white male is considered as having being born with a silver spoon. Itâs also not fair to treat minorities and women as though they need an advantage in the recruitment process as they couldnât get the job on their merit

attributes.action: Teach young adults the struggles of owning a house.
attributes.background: I would like for schools and colleges ect, to teach young adults how hard it is to run a property of their own so when it comes to them having their own property rented, bought or shared accommodation they will know what to do when they come to the hurdles without it ending in them becoming homeless
attributes.additional_details: I strongly agree something like this should be taught budgeting, mortgages. Too many people going into the world with no life skills.

attributes.action: Law requiring food chains to show the calories on menus.
attributes.background:
All food-service chains with 20 or more locations must post the number of calories in the food and drink items they sell.
This law should be implemented as it allows the public to count the amount of calories they eat. It can also reduce the chances of obesity.

attributes.action: Ban all advertising boards on the side of motorways.
attributes.background: Drivers are constantly being threatened with prosecution if they use mobile phones, smoke, vape or do anything that distracts them from driving. Motorway advertising is specifically designed to distract drivers. Some of them have animation and can be very bright by using neon type lighting.
attributes.additional_details: It is a central argument of the government that distractions such as mobile phones etc can affect the driving ability of road users. The same evidence and research can be used to argue that advertising boards have the same effect and are therefore dangerous.

attributes.action: Adopt unilateral free trade with the whole world.
attributes.background: We call upon the Government to adopt Unilateral Free Trade to reduce import costs to consumers and businesses. This means removing all tariffs on goods and services, reducing non-tariff trade barriers and recognising other countries' technical standards as equivalent unilaterally.
attributes.additional_details:
Unilateral free trade is the most pragmatic and fair trade policy for Britain. End discriminatory, mercantilist policies and embrace UFT to (1) lower input costs for businesses and the poorest consumers; (2) allow negotiators to focus on services agreements; (3) stimulate domestic competition; (4) reduce red-tape; and (6) lead by example to make the moral case for free trade. 

If you are unwilling to show leadership on trade issues, Britain's consumers are more than willing to do so.

attributes.action: Change the British military's standard issue rifle to the C8/L119
attributes.background: The British military's current rifle, the SA80/L85, is completely outclassed by the Colt Canada C8SFW Carbine, with its higher stopping power and rate of fire, already in use by special forces, the Royal Military Police and Royal Marine 43 Commando Fleet Protection Group
attributes.additional_details: Already a proven rifle, the swap would increase the effectiveness of a single infantry soldier in a firefight. The similarities to the US M4 would also allow spare parts to be used between us and our most powerful ally, and allow soldiers to pick up each other's weapons, for whatever reason, and already be used to an extremely similar one.

attributes.action: Minimum of 1 England cricket Test match to be on free-to-air TV per year
attributes.background: Cricket participation levels in the United Kingdom are decreasing every year across all age groups (http://bit.ly/2MmseSJ) and this can be linked to the move in 2005 to show all England internationals exclusively on Sky Sports. It's time Test cricket was protected by Ofcom.
attributes.additional_details:
The ECB have recently dedicated to showing 2 T20 England Internationals a year from 2020 (https://ind.pn/2LUb4iV). 

However, this is not enough. It is time that some England Test matches are added to Category A of the "Ofcom Code on Sports and Other Listed and Designated Events" (https://wiki.sh/zehw) with a focus placed on Australia matches during an Ashes series.

attributes.action: Horn honking/sexual slurs shouted out of car windows to women to be an offence.
attributes.background: The majority of women while in public have to endure multiple forms of harassment, from horn honking to misogynistic sexual slurs shouted out of vehicle windows, whether travelling to work or visiting local shops women endure constant verbal harassment. All women should feel safe on our streets.
attributes.additional_details: My personal experience has a 20 year old women living on a main road traveling the 30 minute journey to work I receive upwards of 3 vocal forms of sexual harassment I am made to feel like a piece of meat. Why should this injustice which has occurred for generations in our society be accepted. An online form where victims of this behaviour can report offending vehicle registration numbers to the local authority and a sanction procedure should be in place to prevent these acts being committed.

attributes.action: To cap tax and national insurance on wages.
attributes.background:
There should be a cap on how many hours you should get taxed and insuranced on.
If you work under 22 hours get get tax free but if you work more you get taxed.
It doesnât make sense the more hours you work the more tax you pay. As a person you donât receive any extra.
attributes.additional_details:
If you work under 22 hours get get tax free but if you work more you get taxed.
It doesnât make sense the more hours you work the more tax you pay. As a person you donât receive any extra.I believe there should be a cap on how much tax and national insurance should be taken from your wages. If you work more then 45-50 hours a week, what you do  over should be tax and national insurance free. Personally I work 60-70 hour weeks and get tax an extortionate amount. Which works out I work 15-20 hours free because thatâs how much goes to the groverment.
There should be a cap on tax and national insurance to make it fair for all those people that work those extra hours.

attributes.action: Change the voting system to proportional representation, dump FPTP
attributes.background: Proportional representation means that vote share in the population matches the amount of seats each party gets in an election. First past the post creates a huge disparity between vote share and seats in the House of Commons, with parties receiving millions of votes and just one seat. Details below
attributes.additional_details:
2015 Election:

â¢Conservatives - 331 seats, 11,334,226 votes (36.9%)

â¢Labour - 232 seats, 9,347,273 votes (30.4%)

â¢UKIP - 1 seat, 3,881,099votes (12.6%)

â¢Liberal Democrats - 8 seats, 2,415,916  votes (7.9%)

â¢Green Party - 1 seat, 1,57,630 votes (3.8%)


2017 Election:

â¢Conservatives - 318 seats, 13,636,684 votes (42.4%)

â¢Labour - 262 seats, 12,877,918 votes (40.0%)

â¢Lib Dems - 12 seats, 2,371,861 votes (7.4%)

â¢UKIP - 0 seats, 594,068 votes (1.8%)

bbc.co.uk/news/election/2017/results

attributes.action: Give the Firemen, the Police, The Emergency Services a National Day.
attributes.background: Recently, I celebrated my daughter's 4 year old birthday. I invited the local Fire crew, then local Police. I was absolutely overwhelmed with their kindness in turning up and taking the time in talking to the little ones, their patience, their absolute dedication to their job.
attributes.additional_details: They all have been through so much lately, and I got to realise, why do we celebrate the army, who rightly protect us (My little girl's father is ex military, bomb disposal), but not these people, who risk their life for us on a daily basis. They deserve our support. So very much. Please do help me giving them the chance to parade, be proud, be cheered, be supported.

attributes.action: Provide option to pay an extra 10 to 20% Council Tax & choose where it's spent.
attributes.background:
With all the cuts to services I suggest people are given the OPTION to pay an extra 10, 15 or 20% on their Council Tax via a tick box AND be able to choose where the money is allocated via a few more tick boxes i.e.
- Policing
- NHS
- Schools
- Local Town Council
- Social Services
attributes.additional_details:
Many of us are unhappy & frustrated with the spending cuts that have impacted so many services. There is too much emphasis on keeping Council Tax down without giving people the OPTION to pay more if they want to and have a say in where it is spent. 

I would be happy to pay an extra 10% provided it went on local policing and I am sure many people who could afford it would feel the same, albeit with differing priorities.

attributes.action: Ensure that AFCS pays out for service injury AND the impact to life and family
attributes.background: Currently AFCS pays out for service related injuries. However it does not take into account the impact on life and that of the family. This change would bring the scheme more in line with civilian personal injury claims.

attributes.action: Require drivers over the age of 65 to retake their driving test
attributes.background: As people get older, their reaction times may slow down and their vision may become impaired.

attributes.action: Allow the disabled access to biodegradable single use plastics in any future ban
attributes.background: There has been a considerable number of concerns raised by the disabled community and allies about the need for single use plastics in their lives. I would like the language of any ban on any single use plastics to include an exemption for biodegradable plastics for the disabled community.

attributes.action: Abolish business rates in favour of sales tax to rejuvenate town centres.
attributes.background: Town centres are dying because of crippling business rates so a sales tax makes sense to reduce burdens on start up businesses.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to feed and encourage seagulls to nest
attributes.background: The spiralling number of seagulls in our cities and surrounding suburbs are adversely impacting the mental well-being of residents. Their incessant screeching starts in earnest in the early hours and persists for much of the day. They defecate on property, vehicles and washing and attract vermin
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/weird-news/residents-declare-war-seagulls-poisoned-6098194
http://www.worcesternews.co.uk/news/13581245.New_crackdown_drawn_up_to_tackle__aggressive__seagulls_in_Worcester/
https://www.economist.com/britain/2017/02/09/britains-war-on-seagulls
https://www.fixmystreet.com/report/26682
https://www.theedinburghreporter.co.uk/2017/02/morningside-councillor-wants-council-to-get-rid-of-gulls/
